description.narrative: 100,000 students from primary schools in targeted districts have improved water and sanitation services and hygiene education, which contributes to Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable populations in rural and peri-urban areas have improved access to, and use of, safe and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services.

System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 100,000 students from primary schools in targeted districts have improved water and sanitation services and hygiene education

description.narrative: A total of 129,502 students were reached with water supply X 123,477 students with sanitation in targeted schools. All targeted schools received training on school environmental committees as well as hygiene education. Upstream work has supported latrine design standardization and EMIS integration of WASH indicators. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2017

No. of learners provided access to child friendly drinking water facilities

actual.value: 2016:Water Supply: 49 schools (18,692 learners)Sanitation: 40 schools (25,958 learners)Hygiene: 73 schools (26,143 learners)
